UI_visible_response: Yes, China's economy has been experiencing a slowdown recently. In 2024, the GDP growth rate declined to 4.8 percent year-on-year2. Additionally, it is projected that China's economic growth will continue to slow down, with expectations of 4.8 percent growth in 2024, which is lower than the 5.2 percent growth seen in 20233. The slowdown is further evidenced by the Q3 2024 growth rate of 4.6% year-on-year, marking the slowest annual growth rate during that period6. This trend indicates that China's economy is facing significant challenges and is expected to continue slowing in the foreseeable future1.
traffic_visible_response: Yes, China's economy has been experiencing a slowdown recently. In 2024, the GDP growth rate declined to 4.8 percent year-on-year [[2]]. Additionally, it is projected that China's economic growth will continue to slow down, with expectations of 4.8 percent growth in 2024, which is lower than the 5.2 percent growth seen in 2023 [[3]]. The slowdown is further evidenced by the Q3 2024 growth rate of 4.6% year-on-year, marking the slowest annual growth rate during that period [[6]]. This trend indicates that China's economy is facing significant challenges and is expected to continue slowing in the foreseeable future [[1]].
